stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.

Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.

preGame:
Hooo-eee, step right up, ladies and gentlemen, demons and ghouls! It’s a magnificent, bone-crunching Tuesday night for the greatest sport on any plane of existence! We are live from the perilous, windswept peaks of The Cliffside Pitch in Southport, and let me tell you, the atmosphere is electric! Or maybe that’s just the sea spray hitting the lighthouse! We’re in the thick of the Losers Bracket, Game 2 of a Best of 3, and the stakes are higher than a harpy’s nest! The Tortell Privateers are looking to sweep this series and send the Southport Narwhals to the bottom of the locker—literally! 

I just caught a glimpse of the pre-game rituals, and boy, do these athletes have some moxie! Over in the Privateers' camp, Keisling Damalas is currently painting his teeth with charcoal—talk about a winning smile that only a mother or a mortician could love! Meanwhile, Dib Tufts is doing his usual routine of chugging a raw egg, shell and all! That’s the kind of calcium-rich dedication that wins championships, folks! They’re looking to repeat their performance from last week and put the Narwhals out of their misery once and for all. It’s enough to make a demon weep with joy, much like the time Artorias actually did something useful—oh wait, that never happened! 

But don't count out the hometown favorites! The Narwhals are feeling the pressure of being down one-nil. I saw Loralyn Lyndy adjusting her codpiece with theatrical importance, and Braden Gaile is muttering a nonsensical rhyme that sounds like something Sir Tanos would say after one too many glasses of ritual sangria! The gale-force winds are howling, the rocks are sharp, and the sea spray is making the field as slippery as a deal with a money priest! If my Ebon Gate Corruptors were here, they’d be feasting on the chaos, but since they aren't, I’m rooting for the team that causes the most dental damage! Let’s get to the ball!
postGame:
Wowsers! What a frantic, blood-soaked finale we just witnessed! The Tortell Privateers have done it! They’ve swept the series 2-0, leaving the Southport Narwhals gasping for air like a fish out of water on these rocky outcroppings! It was a 4-2 victory in a heart-pounding overtime session that had me gripping my microphone tighter than a warlock grips a cursed soul! The action was hotter than a furnace in the Demon Prison, and twice as loud! 

The Privateers didn’t waste any time making their presence felt. Dib Tufts snatched the ball right out of the gate, and before the Narwhals could even finish their heroic backstories, Melisande Eustacia launched a magnificent shot from the 2-point zone and found nothing but the bottom of the basket! Talk about a dagger to the heart! It was a beautiful display of skill that would make those stuffy Haven Lights turn even paler with envy! 

The Narwhals tried to fight back through the gale-force winds, but the Cliffside Pitch was a cruel mistress today. Loralyn Lyndy missed a desperation shot that sailed wide enough to hit a passing seagull! However, the momentum shifted when Cilurzo Sochor, probably inspired by his own heroic backstory, stepped up in center field and hammered home a scoring shot to tie this puppy up! The crowd—well, the few tourists who weren't terrified of falling off the cliff—went absolutely bananas! 

Now, let's talk about the real meat of the game: the violence! Goldberg Tova, a real powerhouse for the Privateers, absolutely laid the wood on Blood Eppes, sending him to see Healer Sand Denys with a collection of new and exciting bruises! Not to be outdone, Fineman Dolhenty of the Narwhals retaliated by crunching Castorina Gies into the turf! It was a symphony of snaps, crackles, and pops that was music to my ears, much better than any of that fancy 'Tree Tea' music Maple likes to play! 

As the clock ticked down, the desperation was palpable. We saw more failed tackles than Sir Randy has arrows! Braden Gaile and Malcolm Goer were trying to advance, but the Privateer defense was as stubborn as a Door-enjoying Chairman! The game headed into Overtime, and you could hear a pin drop if it weren't for the roaring ocean and the sound of Keisling Damalas’s charcoal-covered teeth gnashing in anticipation! 

In the extra period, it was a total scramble! Dib Tufts tried a wild pass that was snatched out of the air by Braden Gaile—a heroic interception if I ever saw one, but we all know heroes usually end up facedown in the muck! Sure enough, the momentum flipped again when Loralee Sunny played the thief and intercepted a return pass right back! It was back-and-forth madness that had the players looking more dizzy than a drunk pirate at Imra’s open bar! 

The Narwhals’ defense eventually cracked under the pressure. Braden Gaile, apparently tired of playing nice, absolutely trucked Melisande Eustacia, taking him out of the play, but it wasn't enough to stop the inevitable tide! The Privateers kept their cool despite the spray and the wind, and the ball found its way into the hands of Kidder Starkey. 

With the game on the line and the series hanging in the balance, Kidder Starkey stood tall in the 2-point zone. He thanked his armor one last time, ignored the sea spray in his eyes, and let it fly! SWISH! A 2-pointer to end it all! The Privateers bench cleared, the Narwhals collapsed in despair, and I almost spilled my drink in excitement! 

So, the series ends 2-0 in favor of the Tortell Privateers! They move on, while the Southport Narwhals are left to lick their wounds and perhaps file a few more fingernails for next season! It was a masterclass in playoff grit, a real display of why we love this game—the hits, the drama, and the delicious, delicious failure of those who try to play the hero! 

I haven't seen this much disappointment in Southport since the last time Nezmear tried to explain the difference between a werewolf and a werecow! If you’re looking for the Narwhals, you can probably find them at the bottom of the cliff or drownng their sorrows in whatever rotgut they serve at the lighthouse. As for the Privateers, they’re sailing high on this victory! 

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most dangerous field in Osterra! Remember, folks: life is short, but the Everwar is forever, and Trollball is the only thing that makes it worth living! Stay brutal, stay bloody, and I'll see you next Tuesday for more carnage! Goodnight, you beautiful monsters!
